search.title: Canary Weather
search.subtitle: Check historical weather on the Canary Islands
search.noResultsHint: Try entering the name of a resort or municipality in the Canary Islands.

result.checkConnection: Please try again in a moment
result.calimaDesc: Reduced visibility and higher temperatures possible.
result.calimaInfoWhat: Calima is an atmospheric phenomenon that occurs when eastern and southeastern winds (known as Sirocco or Levante) carry air masses directly from the Sahara Desert to the Canary Islands archipelago. This phenomenon is particularly intense when a strong high-pressure system is located over North Africa.
result.calimaInfoAtmosphereList:
• Orange-yellow or milky haze in the air
• Drastically reduced visibility (sometimes down to tens of meters)
• Dust deposits on all surfaces
result.calimaInfoMeteoList:
• Rapid temperature increase (up to 10-15°C)
• Extremely low humidity (below 20%)
• Feeling of stuffiness and dryness
• No precipitation
result.calimaInfoWhenDesc:
Calima can appear throughout the year, but most commonly:

• Winter/spring (February-April) - stronger episodes
• Summer (July-August) - hotter but often shorter episodes

It usually lasts from a few hours to several days, sometimes even a week.
result.calimaInfoDangersList:
• Reduced air quality and visibility
• Respiratory problems, especially for asthmatics
• Eye and skin irritation
• Temperature increase up to 10°C
• Possible flight disruptions
result.calimaInfoSafetyList:
• Limit time outdoors
• Close windows and use air conditioning
• Drink plenty of water
• Wear sunglasses
• Asthmatics should carry their medication
• Avoid intense physical activity
result.basedOnDays: Based on {{count}} days of historical weather data
result.top3Weeks: Top 3 sunniest weeks of the year
result.summaryModerate: Moderate conditions - prepare for variable weather.
result.summaryPoor: More cloudy days - consider a different time.
result.highAltitudeFallback: No AEMET high-altitude station available. Weather data from {{station}}.

locationPrompt.title: Weather Near You
locationPrompt.description: Allow location access so we can automatically show you the forecast for your current location.
locationPrompt.tooFarTitle: You're not in the Canary Islands
locationPrompt.tooFarMessage: It looks like you're currently far from the Canary Islands. Use the search to find your destination.

onboarding.welcome_text: Canary Weather: Your analytical forecast for the Canary Islands. Don't just look for weather, look for the sun. We analyze 10 years of historical weather data to show you places with the highest chance of clear skies.

sun_chance.title: What is Sun Chance?
sun_chance.description: It's an indicator based on hard data. We analyze measurements from the last 10 years for this specific location and hour to determine the real probability of clear skies. It's historical statistics complementing the live forecast.
